result.execSummary:
The defendant Charese A Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Credit for 45 days-6/3/16 to 7/28/2016.

superMiscConds.notes: Same conditions as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample if not already done.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge; during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Seek/maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

Pursuant to Wisconsin statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
Court advised defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended supervision and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription for herself or her child, taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater tha $250.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
May not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, any body armor, or taser.
Under Section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Lonnie L. Davis dob 7/26/1982 as they were both coactors in the crime in count one and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
Drivers license suspension is not imposed as to count one.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  DOC must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

timeConds.notes:
Forthwith.  Without good time credit. Release for the Day Reporting Center if eligible, and inmate work assignments at HOC only.  
Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
**08-24-16/Order granting additional Huber release privilege. Defendant is allowed Huber release privileges for verified paid scheduled work hours at Age of Elegance Marketing Consultants, LLC, at 6944 North Port Washington Road, Suite L2, Glendale, Wisconsin, in a maximum of six days a week, 10 hours per day, for a total of 60 hours per week. This Huber rlease privileges for work is in addition to the Huber release privileges for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments granted at the sentencing hearing on July 28, 2016. This Huber release privileges for work does not apply to attending classes or performing unpaid or volunteer services, it applies only to verified paid scheduled work hours.

Defendant Charese A Gardner in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Defendant Charese A Gardner in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: nm
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements: William G. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 (TWO) YEARS 6 (SIX) MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 45 days (6-3-16 to 7-28-16) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 (ONE) YEAR 6 (SIX) MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 (ONE) YEAR.

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 2 (TWO) YEARS 6 (SIX) MONTHS.

CONDITION TIME AS TO COUNT 1 FOR PROBATION:
Court ordered defendant to serve 6 (SIX) MONTHS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center (if eligible) and inmate work assignments at the House of correction ONLY. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. FORTHWITH.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, for herself or her child, taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $250.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, any body armor, or taser.
- Seek/Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.
- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Lonnie L. Davis (DOB: 07-26-1982) as they were both co-actors in the crime in COUNT 1 and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Drivers license suspension is NOT imposed as to count 1.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

At the hour of 11:25 the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of guilty which was then read.  

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Charese Gardner, GUILTY of keeping a place used for keeping a controlled substance, as a party to a crime, as charged in the Information."  

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed. 

At the hour of 11:33 jury dismissed.

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 07-15-2016 at 8:30, branch 17.

Defendant Charese A Gardner in court with attorney Lew A Wasserman.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court makes the following findings:
1. Statements made by the defendant to law enforcement officers while detained during the search warrant execution are admissible. The defendant was not under formal arrest and therefore, Miranda warnings were not warranted.
2. Evidence recovered from the defendant's vehicle because of the statements made by the defendant during the search warrant execution is admissible.
3. The search warrant legally covered the search of the defendant's vehicle as it was associated with the address in the search warrant.
Therefore, the defendant's motion to suppress is DENIED.
